subject: Re: [junit] Junit NoClassDefError when attempting to access static members of a class
msgSnippet: Cedric thanks for the reply. ... That makes sense except if I remove the static from ErrorState and just use it as an instance variable everything works. So
messageBody:
Cedric thanks for the reply.

> > I have a JUnit (3.8.1) test (in eclipse 3.1) that attemps to access a
> > class for of statics:
> >
> > public final class SpecifiersHelpers {
> > public static final String DISPLAY_NAME = "A nice name";
> > public static final ErrorState ERROR_STATE = new
> > ErrorState("foo", null);
> > ....
> > }
> >
> > As long as I only attempt to access primitive types I'm ok. But as
> > soon as I attempt to access ERROR_STATE or any other object from
> > SpecifiersHelpers, I get an NoClassDefError. From a little googling I
> > can tell that this is a class loading problem - but beyond that I
> > don't understand. The obvious workaround is just to avoid the use of
> > statics in this situation. However, I want to understand what's going
> > on and how I can safely use statics. BTW I'm using statics here to
> > create a number of commonly defined elements.
>
>
> Probably one of these two things is happening:
>
> - ErrorState is not in your classpath at runtime

That makes sense except if I remove the static from ErrorState and
just use it as an instance variable everything works. So there is
something about creating ErrorState as a static that happens before
the class is loaded.

> - If it is, its constructor is throwing an exception

Its a very simple constructor - just assign a pair of local variables
- no exceptions to be thrown.

Mark
